articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum close to its opening.
					 The museum was newly built as required by the 21st century and its area and the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War turned into a general education center to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War under the grand plan and energetic guidance of Kim Jong Un, who has successfully carried forward the ever-victorious history and tradition started on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Going round different places of the museum, he learned in detail about historical materials and wartime mementoes on display.
					
					 He highly praised soldier-builders in the construction site of the museum for admirably fulfilling their duty and thereby fully displaying the militant spirit of the heroic KPA, which knows nothing impossible.
					
					 Saying that the ceremony for opening the museum is planned to be held grandly, he noted the museum is a treasure-house of the country, a theatre showcasing confrontation with the U.S. and an important base for anti-U.S. education.
					
					 The excellent rebuilding of the museum and the improvement of the surrounding landscape will contribute to educating the servicepersons and people in President Kim Il Sung's Juche-oriented military idea, anti-imperialist revolutionary idea and outstanding commanding arts, and helping them carry forward the fighting spirit and soul of the forerunners, he said.
					
					 He called for making good preparations for the opening and showing the fixed will of Songun Korea to always emerge victorious by carrying forward the tradition of victory displayed by the preceding generations. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Phyong Hae, Kwak Pom Gi, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song and Jo Kyong Chol.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Sao Tome and Principe
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Manuel Pinto Da Costa, president of the Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe, on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the republic.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily develop in line with the common interests and desires of the two peoples.
					
					 It wished the president and people of Sao Tome and Principe success in their work for the national unity and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Syrian Charge d' Affaires A.I.
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Syrian Charge d' Affaires A.I.
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Haissam Saad, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Architects Union of Korea headed by Vice Chairman Sim Yong Hak left here Thursday to visit China.

articles.title: Congratulations from Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Raul Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a congratulatory message from Raul Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, on July 2.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people and government of Cuba on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the DPRK's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 It paid highest tribute to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy from Russian Party Leader
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy from Russian Party Leader
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of sympathy from V. V. Zhirinovsky, chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, on July 5.
					 The message extended sincere sympathy with Kim Jong Un and all the citizens of the DPRK on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of demise of the great leader of the Korean people Kim Il Sung, the sad day in the life of the DPRK. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung protected the interests of the people from the outside enemies and dedicated his life to serving the people, it said.
					
					 The friendship and cooperation between Russia and the DPRK are the most important direction for us, it noted.
					
					 The message wished Kim Jong Un success in the activities of the party and state for the wellbeing of the Korean people.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Chinese ambassador to the DPRK hosted a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Thursday to mark the 52nd anniversary of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health who doubles as chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 Chinese Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of his embassy and Chinese guests staying here were present there.
					
					 Liu in his speech said that Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai and President of the DPRK Kim Il Sung signed the treaty of landmark significance providing the firm foundation for development of the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 For the past 52 years the two countries have supported and cooperated with each other in the spirit of the treaty to promote the steady development of the Sino-DPRK relations of friendship, Liu said. 
					
					 He expressed the will to make efforts to promote the long, stable and sound development of the traditional Sino-DPRK relations and keep eternal vitality. 
					
					 Kang Ha Guk said in his speech the treaty has helped the two countries accelerate their socialist construction and protect the regional peace and stability since its conclusion.
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to boosting the traditional DPRK-China friendship, true to the noble intentions of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					 He evinced his will to make efforts to comprehensively develop the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations on a fresh higher stage as desired by the two peoples.
					
					 Meanwhile, a reception was given at the Chinese consulate general in Chongjin on the same day.

articles.title: Central Areas of DPRK Hit by Downpour
articles.content:
Central Areas of DPRK Hit by Downpour
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Downpour has swept through the central areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea from Tuesday evening.
					 According to data available, 310 mm rainfall was registered in Yangdok County, 290 mm in Yodok County, 287 mm in Sukchon County, 273 mm in Kowon County, 266 mm in Munchon City, 260 mm in Tokchon City, 243 mm in Sinyang County, 242 mm in Hoechang County, 240 mm in Chonnae County, 236 mm respectively in Phyongsong City and Pukchang County, 231 mm in Maengsan County, 222 mm in Kumya and Songchon counties respectively, 218 mm in Samsok District, 216 mm in Anbyon County, 213 mm in Mundok County, 212 mm in Kaechon and Wonsan cities respectively, 204 mm in Popdong County and 200 mm in Nyongwon County, from 18:00 Tuesday to 06:00 Thursday.
					
					 Some 10 localities have seen more than 150 mm rainfalls, including Pyongyang City, Sungho County, Sunchon City, Pakchon County, Kujang County, Phyongwon County and Anju City.
					
					 On July 10-11, downpour has hit Sukchon, Pukchang, Kowon, Mundok, Yangdok and Maengsan counties, Munchon City and other areas.
					
					 The rainfall is likely to continue until July 16.

articles.title: DPRK Gymnast Wins Gold Medal at Universiad
articles.content:
DPRK Gymnast Wins Gold Medal at Universiad
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK gymnast Hong Un Jong bagged a gold medal in the female long horse event of the 27th Universiad held on Wednesday.
					 She proved successful at the 29th Olympics, the Artistic Gymnastics World Cup and other international games.
					
					 The DPRK women's volleyball team beat its rivals of Slovakia, Taipei of China and China 3:0 respectively in Group C, coming first in the group.

articles.title: DPRK Judokas Prove Successful at Military Judo Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Judokas Prove Successful at Military Judo Championship
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK judoka Kim Su Gyong bagged a gold medal in women's 63 kg category of the 35th World Military Judo Championship held in Astana.
					 Bronze medals in women's 48 kg and 70 kg categories and men's 66 kg category went to Jon Yu Sun, Song Son Yong and Choe Yong Sik. 
					
					 The championship brought together over 260 players from 28 countries including the DPRK and regions.
					
					 DPRK judokas returned home on Thursday.

articles.title: Japanese Figure Fascinated by Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Japanese Figure Fascinated by Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- In July Juche 64 (1975) Yoshiko Otaka, a member of the House of Councilors of Japan, visited the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as a member of the Japanese delegation of influential lawmakers from the Liberal Democratic Party.
					 When Otaka was a girl, she engaged herself in comforting the Japanese aggression army in Korea and Manchuria with the name of Ri Hyang Ran.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung met the visiting delegation for hours and arranged a dinner for it.
					
					 During the dinner, Kim Il Sung asked Otaka whether she was active as a singer in the past in the name of Ri Hyang Ran. He said he could know her name through magazine and film. And he added there should be songs and dances in human life, thus calming down her who was at a loss what to do.
					
					 Otaka was moved to tears by such broad-minded magnanimity of the President holding the present more important than the past.
					
					 As the delegation was leaving him, he shook their hands one by one, recommending them to go sightseeing in the world-famous Mt. Kumgang when they come again to the DPRK.
					
					 Otaka was so fascinated by Kim Il Sung, who gave warm hospitality to them.
					
					 When she visited Pyongyang again later, she sang "Song of General Kim Il Sung" in Korean before the President.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Pays Deep Attention to People's Living in Wartime
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Pays Deep Attention to People's Living in Wartime
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- During the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953), President Kim Il Sung paid deep attention to stabilizing the people's livelihood.
					 Though there were victims to U.S. bombings, there was no man starved or frozen to death in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea in the wartime.
					
					 At a meeting of the Political Committee of the Central Committee of the Workers' party of Korea on January 21, Juche 40 (1951), Kim Il Sung made a concluding speech "Some Tasks of Stabilizing the People's Livelihood in Wartime". In the speech he underscored the need not to be indifferent to the people's life under the pretext of wartime conditions, indicating the orientation and ways for stabilizing the people's livelihood.
					
					 He made sure that a series of Cabinet decisions were adopted on raising the ratio of food supply to families of workers, technicians and clerks and providing additional food to them at a low price.
					
					 The decisions envisaged the exemption of tax payment the peasants had in arrears and the state's loan of food and seed they lacked. They also called for building houses at the state expense for the people who were left homeless.
					
					 Meanwhile, Kim Il Sung took a measure to bring up the bereaved children of patriotic martyrs and war orphans at the state expense. In line with this measure, orphanages and schools for the bereaved or orphaned children were built across the country, starting their operation on April 1, 1951.
					
					 Under his deep care, injured people were given first aid free of charge and well-regulated hygienic and anti-epidemic system was set up throughout the country. And the universal free healthcare system was introduced in the country in January 1953.

articles.title: US Bombardment in Korean War, Unprecedented in History
articles.content:
US Bombardment in Korean War, Unprecedented in History
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- In the Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27. 1953) the U.S. imperialists indiscriminately bombarded cities and rural communities in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, reducing all of them to ashes.
					Declaring that it would stamp out 78 cities of the DPRK on the map, the U.S. dropped over 428,700 bombs in Pyongyang City alone during the three-year war, which accounted for more than one per citizen.
					
					 Schools and hospitals were not exception in the air raids.
					
					It destroyed 4,879km of railroads, 4,009km of roads, 1,109km of bridges, 1,489 locomotives, 4,803 vehicles and more than 6,000 fishing boats and vessels, as well as many reservoirs and their facilities.
					
					The bombings left 563,700 hectares of farmland ravaged, killing millions of domestic animals.
					
					 The damage was so devastating that the U.S. said the DPRK could not rise up again in 100 years.
					
					 The facts clearly show that the U.S. is the sworn enemy of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Serves as Revolutionary Idea: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Serves as Revolutionary Idea: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Steady victories won in acute confrontation with imperialists and the building of an economic power fully demonstrate the invincible might of the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the guiding idea of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in an editorial article titled "Long live the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism!"
					
					 It is the great historical feats performed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un for the times and revolution that he made sure Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism would shine forever as the eternal guiding idea of the WPK and the revolution, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 More than eight decades since the foundation of the great Juche idea witnessed alien ideological trends of all hues and acute confrontation between the progressive idea and reactionary idea. There was no such revolutionary idea as Kimilsungism which invariably guided the revolution and promoted the movement for the advance of humankind, preserving its vitality amid unprecedented turbid ideological trends.
					
					 The revolutionary idea of leader Kim Jong Il played a decisive role in making great Kimilsungism shed its rays for centuries. The vitality of Kimilsungism would be unthinkable without the might and attractive power of Kimjongilism.
					
					 Kimjongilism is based on Kimilsungism and the essence of the latter has been preserved and developed in depth thanks to the former.
					
					 Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the undying revolutionary idea to shine as the eternal great guiding idea of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The eternity of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism finds its manifestation in the fact that it fully meets the requirements of the developing times in the most correct way. It also finds its expression in its strong popular character.
					
					 The decisive factor of its vitality lies in that Kim Jong Un, a genius of ideology and theory in the present times, is standing at the helm of the revolution.
					
					 His creative ideological and theoretical activities will provide new unique theories one after another to meet the need of the times and enrich the treasure-house of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the days go by.

articles.title: Unbreakable DPRK-China Friendship: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Unbreakable DPRK-China Friendship: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK and China are neighbors geographically close to each other and the DPRK-China friendship is an unbreakable one forged with militant fraternity in the days of the arduous struggle including the anti-Japanese war and the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in an article dedicated to the 52nd anniversary of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					
					 The treaty was signed on July 11, 1961. 
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship has developed in line with the desire and interests of the two peoples over the past 50 odd years, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean people are rejoiced as over their own over the achievements made by the Chinese people in the efforts to build a comprehensively well-off society under the uplifted banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to developing the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations true to the noble intention of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He sent his special envoy to China, an expression of his fixed will to carry forward and boost the DPRK-China friendship provided and cultivated by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people will as ever make positive efforts to boost the traditional DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts S. Korean FM for Speaking Ill of DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts S. Korean FM for Speaking Ill of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- South Korean officials who were represented at the 20th ASEAN regional forum held in Brunei sat with their U.S. and Japanese masters on the sidelines of its ministerial meeting in which they cried out for "dismantlement of the north's nukes".
					 Foreign Minister of south Korea Yun Pyong Se asked several countries to put pressure on the DPRK and "send the continued voice of urging it to make earlier response for denuclearization and improvement of the south-north ties". He went busy, reaffirming the cooperation from Washington and Tokyo regarding the nuke issue.
					
					 Yun's act of tabling the issue of the nation's deterrence for self-defence at the international forum is one of treacherous acts indicative of his dependence on foreign forces and sycophancy toward them.
					
					 It is preposterous for the present south Korean ruling forces to cry out for "the north's dismantlement of nukes" as they have taken an active part in applying "sanctions" on the DPRK and in the moves for provoking a nuclear war, while kowtowing to outsiders since taking office.
					
					 The south Korean regime has taken the lead in anti-DPRK moves, notably its assertions that the "north will get nothing unless it abandons nukes and there is better option." The regime spoke ill of the strategic line advanced by the DPRK to bolster nuclear force for self-defence.
					
					 The regime has been engaged in "sanctions" against the DPRK to encroach upon its sovereign right following its success in launching satellite for peaceful purposes and the underground nuclear test aimed at self-defence.
					
					 It brought to south Korea nuclear strategic bombers, nuclear submarines, nuclear carrier task force and other preemptive nuclear strike means from the U.S., holding nuclear war drills in the sky, land and sea.
					
					 As if it were not enough with this, the south Korean chief executive called for "north's dismantlement" of nuclear deterrence for self-defence, talking about "north's dismantlement of nukes" whenever she make foreign trips.
					
					 The war deterrence of which the regime speaks ill is aimed to defend the sovereignty, dignity and supreme interests of the country from enemy's aggression.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean regime are watching for every chance for provoking a war, gravely threatening the DPRK with nukes. Under this situation it does not make sense for the DPRK to scrap nukes.
					
					  No one is entitled to say this or that about the DPRK's possession of nukes, which is like its life and treasure, unless the hostile policy toward the DPRK is repealed.

articles.title: KCNA Decries S. Korean Intelligence Service
articles.content:
KCNA Decries S. Korean Intelligence Service
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- South Koreans are becoming increasingly stronger in denouncing the Intelligence Service (IS) for interfering in the "presidential election" and making public the minutes of the 2007 north-south summit.
					 Lots of civic and public organizations, the Federation of University Students and opposition parties published the declarations on the situation and held candlelight rallies, demonstrations and other mass actions.
					
					 This is an eruption of their pent-up grudge and wrath against the regime of conservatives who stoop to any infamy to meet their dirty political greed.
					
					 Historically the south Korean regimes mobilized the whole gamut of fascist methods to seize and maintain power whenever the situation turned unfavorable for them.
					
					 There are a number of examples, typically the March 15 election fraud orchestrated by puppet clique Syngman Rhee, the May 16 military coup engineered by gangster Park Chung-hee and the bloody suppression of Kwangju uprisers by murderer Chun Doo Hwan.
					
					 The history of the IS whose predecessors were the Central Intelligence Agency and the Security Planning Board is replete with crimes of cracking down by force on people's struggle for independence, democracy and reunification, the crime of propping up the dictatorial "government" with all sorts of political intrigues and gimmicks.
					
					 The present regime succeeded in coming to power under the sponsorship of IS. With this coming to light, the regime made public the minutes, a thing unprecedented in the history of the north-south relations, to divert the public attention to the campaign of eliminating "forces following the north".
					
					 This proves that the present ruling quarters are as the same sordid tricksters as the conservatives of the preceding regimes.
					
					 It is quite natural that a broad spectrum of south Koreans brand the recent fraudulent case as a "swindle worse than the March 15 election fraud" and "coup", and strongly call for the nullification of the 18th-term "presidential election" and resignation of the incumbent rulers.
					
					 All the disclosures of backstage political stories in south Korea have been followed by the people's protest.
					
					 The situation is a clear proof of the sordid intelligence-based politics that continue in south Korea.
					
					 What south Korea claims as politics is an unpopular and fascist one providing an unlimited power and wealth to a handful of the privileged in return for violating the sovereign rights and interests of people. Genuine democratic policy for the toiling masses can be guaranteed only when the unpopular political system is overturned.

articles.title: S. Korean IS Accused of Its Foolish Action
articles.content:
S. Korean IS Accused of Its Foolish Action
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore in an editorial on July 8 accused the Intelligence Service (IS) of its foolish action.
					 The editorial recalled that a spokesman for the IS in a recent press conference made such astonishing remarks that the minutes of the south-north summit in 2007 was worked out with an aim to gather information, an inherent job of the IS, and that the minutes it prepared in October, 2007 to hand over to Chongwadae was no more than an intermediate version and it has kept the finial version worked out in January, 2008, without handing it over to Chongwadae.
					
					 This is just an example showing what awful way of thinking the IS has, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 It is stunning, indeed, that an intelligence organ had an access to what the "president" said at the summit for the purpose of "gathering information."
					
					 These unimaginable remarks made by the IS spokesman at a press conference, unhindered, indicate that the IS has reached the height in understanding of the twisted reality and arrogant attitude.
					
					 The same can be said of the tape recorder used during the summit.
					
					 The spokesman said that Chongwadae should return the recorder as it belongs to the IS.
					
					 Unbelievable is the explanation that the recorder belonged to the IS in view of the situation which prevailed at that time. So, more deplorable is the IS's contention that it has the ownership of the minutes as the recorder belongs to it.
					
					 This clearly explains why the IS reform is so urgent.
					
					 The IS should no longer be allowed to exercise dangerous power as it goes reckless, unaware of the main principle of gathering and preservation of information.

articles.title: Teachers' Union Flays IS for Its Interference in Election
articles.content:
Teachers' Union Flays IS for Its Interference in Election
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Teachers Trade Union held a press conference in Seoul on July 9 at which it issued a declaration on the situation denouncing the Intelligence Service (IS) for illegally interfering in the election.
					 The declaration condemned the IS for turning the clock back through the anachronistic interference in the election, the action to mislead public opinion and suppression of the progressive bodies.
					
					 It called for severely punishing those involved in the case.
					
					 Unless the "government" complies with the demand of the organization, it will organize a large-scale action of teachers to cope with the prevailing situation and carry on a joint campus struggle to achieve democracy across south Korea.
					
					 On the same day teachers at Chungang University, Pusan National University, and Kongju and Pugyong universities started a similar action.
					
					 In their declarations, they noted that the IS's interference in the election and its investigation into civilians are the serious political scandals, demanding the present chief executive apologize to the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Mexico
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in booklet by the Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico on July 3.
					 The work, a speech made by him on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), says the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to demonstrate the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Seminars on Exploits of Kim Il Sung Held Abroad
articles.content:
Seminars on Exploits of Kim Il Sung Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Tajikistan, the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the University of Abuja in Nigeria and the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. of Indonesia held seminars on exploits of President Kim Il Sung between July 3 and 5 on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of his demise.
					 Kurbonzyon Mirzoyeva, member of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, praised the President as the founder of socialist Korea and an outstanding thinker and theoretician.
					
					 Lyudmil Kostadinov, chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, and other speakers said the President devoted himself not only to the country and people but also to global independence.
					
					 Aba Sadik Abubakr, professor and doctor of the University of Abuja who is also chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, said the President absolutely relied on the unfathomable strength of the popular masses and unfolded and led the anti-Japanese war to victory with neither state-backing home front nor assistance of a regular army. He also dealt at the U.S. imperialists a severe defeat in the Fatherland Liberation War and built the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence, the chairman added.
					
					 Harn Sinuraya, director of the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. of Indonesia, noted as follows:
					
					 The President was a distinguished leader who made great exploits not only for the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation but for the development of the non-aligned movement and wisely led the struggle of the progressive people aspiring after independence.
					
					 As the Korean people have the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of the President, they will surely win victory in the stand-off with the U.S. imperialists and build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Praised for Contribution to Cause of Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Praised for Contribution to Cause of Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association posted a special write-up on its website on July 3 to mark the 41st anniversary of the July 4 joint statement.
					 The website noted the joint statement clarifying the three principles of national reunification was adopted between the north and the south of Korea on July 4, 1972.
					
					 The DPRK proposed founding the Federal Republic of Koryo but south Korea came up with a "resolution on the simultaneous admission into the UN by the north and the south of Korea" seeking the permanent national division, pursuant to the U.S. policy, the website said, and went on:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung advanced a series of proposals for reunification and conducted energetic activities to prevent the division of the nation and reunify the country.
					
					 Even at the last moment of his life he signed a document related to reunification.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il provided the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration to implement the last instructions of the President for national reunification.
					
					 We highly appreciate the great contribution made by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to Korea's reunification and will stage dynamic activities to support the DPRK's peaceful initiative and resolute will for achieving detente and reconciliation on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held by the Moscow Branch of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia and the Moscow War Veterans' Committee between July 4 and 6 to mark the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised the undying exploits the President performed for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence. 
					
					 Under the wise leadership of the President Korea, once a backward colonial semi-feudal state, turned into a socialist power centered on the popular masses, he said, adding that this gives pleasure and hope to the world progressive people but fear to the imperialists. 
					
					 He expressed belief that socialism of Korea would foil the moves of the U.S. and its allied forces to stifle the DPRK and win one victory after another as the dear respected Kim Jong Un has successfully carried forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia, said that Kim Il Sung developed the DPRK into a socialist power and the Korean People's Army into an invincible army. By defending socialism he instilled great confidence into the world revolutionary people and clearly indicated the way to be followed by them, the chairman added. 
					
					 Ivan Sulukhai, chairman of the Moscow War Veterans' Committee, praised Kim Il Sung as the benefactor of the national liberation, founder of the DPRK and iron-willed commander who firmly defended the dignity of the country and the nation. 
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, the Korean people will surely build a thriving socialist nation, he stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre nuevamente museo conmemorativo de victoria en guerra
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre nuevamente museo conmemorativo de victoria en guerra
Pyongyang, 11 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria en visperas de inauguracion. 
					Gracias al gran proposito y energica guia del Mariscal quien continua con brillantez la historia y la tradicion de invencible victoria preparadas en el monte Paektu, el museo se ha levantado nuevamente a las alturas del siglo 21 y la zona periferica, inclusive el Monumento a la Victoria, se ha convertido en una base de educacion general con motivo del 60o aniversario del triunfo en la pasada guerra coreana. 
					
					En su recorrido por varios lugares del museo, el hizo conocimiento detallado de los datos y objetos exhibidos. 
					
					Valoro altamente el hecho de que los constructores militares demostraron el impetu combativo del heroico Ejercito Popular de Corea, que no conoce las imposibilidades, al cumplir magnificamente la mision asumida. 
					
					Diciendo que piensa organizar con solemnidad  la ceremonia inaugural del museo, lo califico de tesoro nacional, escenario de confrontacion antiyanqui e importante base de educacion antiyanqui.
					
					Afirmo que la transformacion del museo y sus alrededores contribuira al aprendizaje profundo de la autoctona idea militar, la revolucionaria antiimperialista y el destacado arte de mando del Presidente y a la educacion de todos los militares y habitantes orientada a hacerles continuar el noble espiritu de lucha de los martires. 
					
					Resalto la necesidad de preparar bien la inauguracion para manifestar en esa ocasion a todo el mundo la invariable voluntad de la Corea del Songun de alcanzar siempre victorias continuando la tradicion invicta hecha por las generaciones anteriores.
					
					Acompanaron al Mariscal en esta ocasion Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Phyong Hae, Kwak Pom Gi, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song y Jo Kyong Chol.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam desea exitos al presidente de Sao Tome y Principe
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam desea exitos al presidente de Sao Tome y Principe
Pyongyang, 11 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 9 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Sao Tome y Principe, Manuel Pinto Da Costa, con motivo del 38o aniversario de proclamacion de la independencia y de la Republica de ese pais. 
					El remitente manifiesta la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran cada dia mas conforme a los intereses y aspiracion comunes de los pueblos de los dos paises y desea exitos al destinatario y a su pueblo en las labores para la unidad nacional y la prosperidad del pais.

Continuan lluvias torrenciales en la zona central de Corea
Pyongyang, 11 de julio (ACNC) -- Segun estadisticas disponibles, desde las 18 del dia 9 hasta las 6 del dia 11, se precipitaron 310mm en el distrito de Yangdok, 290mm en el de Yodok, 287mm en el de Sukchon, 273mm en el de Kowon, 266mm en la ciudad de Munchon, 260mm en la ciudad de Tokchon, 243mm en el distrito de Sinyang, 242mm en el de Hoechang, 240mm en el de Chonnae, 236mm en la ciudad de Phyongsong y el distrito de Pukchang, 231mm en el distrito de Maengsan, 222mm en los de Kumya y Songchon, 218mm en el municipio de Samsok, 216mm en el distrito de Anbyon, 213mm en el de Mundok, 212mm en las ciudades de Kaechon y Wonsan, 204mm en el distrito de Popdong, 200mm en el de Nyongwon.
					El caudal de precipitaciones marco mas de 150mm en mas de 10 localidades, entre otras, las ciudades de Pyongyang, Sunchon y Anju y los distritos de Sungho, Pakchon, Kujang y Phyongwon.
					
					Los dias 10 y 11 tambien, cayeron lluvias torrenciales en los distritos de Sukchon, Pukchang, Kowon, Mundok, Yangdok, Maengsan, la ciudad de Munchon y otras zonas. 
					
					Los especialistas estiman que tal meteoro continuara hasta el dia 16.
